snippet: The report provided incriminating new evidence of Syrian government culpability in the Aug. 21 attack, in which banned chemical weapons were used.
abstract: United Nations report confirms that deadly chemical arms attack caused mass killing in Syria last month and for the first time provides extensive forensic details of weapons used, which strongly implicates Syrian government; report's authors do not assign blame, but details appear to undercut arguments by Pres Bashar al-Assad that rebel forces were responsible.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and C. J. CHIVERS
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael R. Gordon from Paris, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon, and David E. Sanger from New York.

lead_paragraph: The report provided incriminating new evidence of Syrian government culpability in the Aug. 21 attack, in which banned chemical weapons were used.

headline.main: Forensic Details in U.N. Report Point to Assad’s Use of Gas
headline.print_headline: U.N. Implicates Syria in Using Chemical Arms

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
